metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7575 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.20.2, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 43.0.2 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.5.2, does not reject MD5 signatures in Server Key Exchange messages in TLS 1.2 Handshake Protocol traffic, which makes it easier for man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof servers by triggering a collision.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libgnutls-openssl27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.4
libgnutls26 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.4
libgnutlsxx27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.4+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2.4').
gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2.4').
gnutls28: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.19.2.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b38-1.13.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u95-2.6.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
openssl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.16').
polarssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
